results.title: Dreamspeakers
results.creator_credit: Greg Coves, Andy Thompson and Great North Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “From spirit to spirit (A)”.
The Dreamspeaker Festival is held in Alberta, Canada and is a unique celebration of art, culture and films of First nation people from around the world. Artists and storytellers gather to share histories, struggles and common goals.

results.title: Gathering threads = Tui Tuia
results.creator_credit: Christina Ngahuia Asher, Carol J Paewai, TopShelf Productions and Nga Kara Whetu
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “From spirit to spirit (A)”.
The art of weaving is an important cultural, social and economic activity among the Maori and Pacific Islander peoples. Aotearoa Moananui and Kiwa weavers are determined to continue the craft. Modern technology has allowed them to cultivate, protect and develop their art as part of their heritage.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Christina Ngahuia Asher, Carol J Paewai, TopShelf Productions and Nga Kara Whetu

results.title: Making waves = Te upoko o te ika
results.creator_credit: Whetu Fala, Carol J Paewai, TopShelf Productions and Nga Kara Whetu
results.brief_description:
Episode number 10 of Series “From spirit to spirit (A)”.
The story of the Te Upoko o te ika, Maori radio station in Wellington, New Zealand. The station fights to survive in a world where ratings and market share are paramount. This program captures one day in the life of a radio station which aims to bring Maori traditions, language and culture to the modern world.

results.title: Dad's tools
results.creator_credit: Fred Atwell, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: There is a lot to do after a bushfire but Fred Atwell wants more than anything to find his dad’s cherished homemade tools. This Digital Storytelling project was created in partnership with Latrobe City and Arts Victoria.

results.title: Keepers of the fire
results.creator_credit: Nola Wuttunee, Brenda Hennig, Andy Thomson and Great North Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 11 of Series “From spirit to spirit (A)”.
This program focuses on the work of four Elders from a North American Indian tribe in Canada, who were survivors of the prison system. After leaving the reserves, it is not uncommon for those who had made the move to the city, to become caught in a vicious cycle within the criminal justice system. The Elders attempt to work with young offenders using their own experiences and knowledge of the traditional way of life, to educate the young people into developing a sense of self worth and hopefully prevent them from becoming caught in a similar cycle.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Nola Wuttunee, Brenda Hennig, Andy Thomson and Great North Productions

results.brief_description: An international co-production recognising the indigenous peoples of Australia, Canada, New Zealand and Sweden, made by indigenous filmmakers. The episodes reflect the amazing diversity of cultural tradition and heritage of indigenous communities.

results.title: Visit from Africa
results.creator_credit: James Cullingham, Gil Cardinal, Andy Thomson, Tamarack Productions and Great North Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 12 of Series “From spirit to spirit (A)”.
Documents the visit of two South Africans to Cree tribes in Northern Quebec, Canada, showing how indigenous people forge links to make a better future for themselves by discussing relevant issues.
results.creator_credit_for_label: James Cullingham, Gil Cardinal, Andy Thomson, Tamarack Productions and Great North Productions

results.title: Mungo lady (A)
results.creator_credit: Mari Bennett, Rachel Perkins and Blackfella Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 9 of Series “From spirit to spirit (A)”.
In 1960 the remains of an Aboriginal woman were exhumed at Lake Mungo, NSW by the white anthropologist/archaeologist, Alan Thorne. The woman had been cremated at least 25,000 years ago, providing the first evidence of this practice, and evidence for elaborate funerary customs by Aborigines in pre-historic times. The remains were exhibited around the world, before being returned to the Aborigines in 1990. This program takes a look at this incident from an Aboriginal perspective.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mari Bennett, Rachel Perkins and Blackfella Films

The remains were exhibited around the world, before being returned to the Aborigines in 1990. This program takes a look at this incident from an Aboriginal perspective.

results.title: Vanishing frontier
results.creator_credit: Nils Gaup, Four Winds Productions and Min Govat Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “From spirit to spirit (A)”.
The Sami are an ancient tribe of reindeer herders in the far north of Sweden whose traditions are being challenged by the 20th Century. This program documents the effects of Soviet policies on the Samis. Will they be able to fight back and have access to reindeer grazing land again?
results.creator_credit_for_label: Nils Gaup, Four Winds Productions and Min Govat Productions

results.title: Generation 2000 = Whakatupuranga rua mano
results.creator_credit: Nan Wehipeihana, Carol J Paewai, TopShelf Productions and Nga Kara Whetu
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “From spirit to spirit (A)”.
In order to ensure that their tribal cultures and traditions survive and thrive into the next millenium, Maori people have fought to develop a 25 year plan to integrate their traditional way of life into current educational programs.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Nan Wehipeihana, Carol J Paewai, TopShelf Productions and Nga Kara Whetu
